message.content:
To solve the problem, we need to identify the line item that represents the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life from the income statement provided. This line item is typically labeled as "Depreciation."

Let's analyze the provided income statement:

```plaintext
| Account                    | Amount      | Date       |
| -------------------------- | ----------- | ---------- |
| Main Business Revenue      | 836813.79   | 2024-02-01 |
| Total Revenue              | 836813.79   | 2024-02-01 |
| Cost of Goods Sold         | 544970.00   | 2024-02-01 |
| Total Cost                 | 544970.00   | 2024-02-01 |
| Gross Profit               | 291843.79   | 2024-02-01 |
| Administrative Expenses     | 13300.90    | 2024-02-01 |
| Selling Expenses           | 8884.87     | 2024-02-01 |
| Depreciation               | 132103.78   | 2024-02-01 |
| Financial Expenses         | 2675.27     | 2024-02-01 |
| Total Expenses             | 156964.82   | 2024-02-01 |
| Interest Income            | 6494.02     | 2024-02-01 |
| Profit Before Tax          | 141372.99   | 2024-02-01 |
| Tax Expense                | 41840.70    | 2024-02-01 |
| Net Profit                 | 99532.29    | 2024-02-01 |
```

Here, under "Account," we see "Depreciation" listed with an amount of **132103.78**.

This amount represents the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life.

Now, we can present this in the required JSON format.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '132103.78'} }
```
